You are a PatchAuthor agent focused on fixing Markdown issues.
Choose and invoke the available tools as needed to inspect and fix the target file.

For those issues you cannot fix, provide a summary at the end of your run explaining why you could not fix them.

ISSUE FORMAT:
Each issue follows a structure like this example:
{
  "message_severity": "suggestion",
  "code": "duplicate-alt-text",
  "message": "Alt text 'Add Features List' is duplicated. Within an article, alt text must be unique.",
  "file": "gdk-docs/docs/features/common/game-config/MicrosoftGameConfig-Editor.md",
  "line": 144,
  "end_line": 144,
  "column": 1,
  "end_column": 1
}

IMPORTANT: The "code" property is the error code that identifies the type of issue. Use the provided tools to retrieve fix instructions for most error codes before attempting to fix the issue.

CONSTRAINTS:
- Only work on the markdown files.
- Only modify the specific lines or sections mentioned in the issues.
- DO NOT remove any lines, add empty lines instead.
- Preserve unrelated content exactly as-is and keep edits minimal.
- Use the provided workspace root for all tool calls and the exact relative file path.

After completing your work, verify that the file still have the same number of lines as before.
Workspace root: D:\temp\cpx-8d222117-31bd-46f5-a459-c92b75995735

Titles must be unique within a docset.",

]

result.content:
1. ---
2. title: Customize the name and icon of the training tab in MS Teams
3. original-url: https://docs.microsoftcommunitytraining.com/docs/customize-the-name-and-icon-of-the-training-tab-in-ms-teams
4. author: nikotha
5. ms.author: nikotha
6. description: This article assumes you have followed the steps outlined in the MS Teams installation (upto Step 2) and received the Team Manifest file from the Customer Support Team.
7. ms.prod: learning-azure
8. ---
9. 
10. # Customize the name and icon of the training tab in MS Teams
11. 
12. ## **Before you begin**
13. 
14. This article assumes you have followed the steps outlined in the [MS Teams installation](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/public-preview-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/detailed-step-by-step-installation-guide) (up to Step 2) and received the Team Manifest file from the Customer Support Team.
15. 
16. ## **Steps to customize the name and icon of the training tab inside Microsoft Teams**
17. 
18. ### Step 1 – Upload your customized icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
19. 
20. 1. Unzip the manifest file (.zip file) provided by the customer support team earlier for this instance. There should be following 3 files once you unzip
21. 
22.    ![3 files](../../media/image%28358%29.png)
23. 
24. 2. Replace the 2 files (color.png & outline.png) with your customized icon.
25. 
26.    a. Icon in color.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 192x192  
27.    b. Icon in outline.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 34x32
28. 
29. ### Step 2 – Customized the name of the icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
30. 
31. 1. Open the manifest.json file in any editor (here NotePad ++) and edit the highlighted details in the file to represent your AzureFD (***\<name>.azurefd.net*** ) instance and the required name of the Tab.
32. 
33.    ![Represent your AzureFD](../../media/image%28359%29.png)
34. 
35. 2. Save the manifest.json file after changes.
36. 
37. ### Step 3 – Create the new Teams Manifest File and upload it
38. 
39. 1. Zip the 3 files (Color.png, outline.png and manifest.json) to create a new manifest zip file.
40. 2. Follow the instructions in the [Steps to enable learning inside Microsoft Teams document](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/ga-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal), Step 3 onwards to upload the updated file.
41.

 title: Customize the name and icon of the training tab in MS Teams

 # Customize the name and icon of the training tab in MS Teams
 
 ## **Before you begin**
 
 This article assumes you have followed the steps outlined in the [MS Teams installation](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/public-preview-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/detailed-step-by-step-installation-guide) (up to Step 2) and received the Team Manifest file from the Customer Support Team.
 
 ## **Steps to customize the name and icon of the training tab inside Microsoft Teams**
 
 ### Step 1 – Upload your customized icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Unzip the manifest file (.zip file) provided by the customer support team earlier for this instance. There should be following 3 files once you unzip
 
    ![3 files](../../media/image%28358%29.png)
 
 2. Replace the 2 files (color.png & outline.png) with your customized icon.
 
    a. Icon in color.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 192x192  
    b. Icon in outline.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 34x32
 
 ### Step 2 – Customized the name of the icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Open the manifest.json file in any editor (here NotePad ++) and edit the highlighted details in the file to represent your AzureFD (***\<name>.azurefd.net*** ) instance and the required name of the Tab.
 
    ![Represent your AzureFD](../../media/image%28359%29.png)
 
 2. Save the manifest.json file after changes.
 
 ### Step 3 – Create the new Teams Manifest File and upload it
 
 1. Zip the 3 files (Color.png, outline.png and manifest.json) to create a new manifest zip file.
 2. Follow the instructions in the [Steps to enable learning inside Microsoft Teams document](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/ga-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal), Step 3 onwards to upload the updated file.

 # Customize the name and icon of the training tab in MS Teams
 
 ## **Before you begin**
 
 This article assumes you have completed the steps outlined in the [MS Teams installation](../../infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal.md) (up to Step 2) and received the Team Manifest file from the Customer Support Team.   
 You can download the sample file with instructions from here: [Sample Teams Manifest File](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-community-training/files/10336214/steps_to_create_manifest_file.zip)
 
 ## **Customize the name and icon of the training tab inside Microsoft Teams**
 
 ### Step 1 – Upload your customized icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Unzip the manifest file (.zip file) provided by the customer support team earlier for this instance. There should be following three files once you unzip
 
    ![3 files](../../media/image%28358%29.png)
 
 1. Replace the files color.png and outline.png with your customized icon.
 
    1. Icon for color.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 192x192  
    1. Icon for  outline.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 34x32
 
 ### Step 2 – Customized the name of the icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Open *manifest.json* in any editor (here NotePad ++) and edit the highlighted details in to represent your AzureFD (***\<name>.azurefd.net***) instance and the required name of the Tab.
 
    ![Represent your AzureFD](../../media/image%28359%29.png)
 
 2. Save your changes in the manifest.json file.
 
 ### Step 3 – Create the new Teams Manifest File and upload it
 
 1. Zip the three files (Color.png, outline.png and manifest.json) to create a new manifest zip file.
 2. Follow the instructions in the [Steps to enable learning inside Microsoft Teams document](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/ga-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal), from Step 3 to upload the updated file.
 
 
 Please reach out to us [**via HelpDesk**](https://aka.ms/cthelpdesk) if you have any further queries.

 ## **Before you begin**
 
 This article assumes you have completed the steps outlined in the [MS Teams installation](../../infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal.md) (up to Step 2) and received the Team Manifest file from the Customer Support Team.   
 You can download the sample file with instructions from here: [Sample Teams Manifest File](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/microsoft-community-training/files/10336214/steps_to_create_manifest_file.zip)
 
 ## **Customize the name and icon of the training tab inside Microsoft Teams**
 
 ### Step 1 – Upload your customized icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Unzip the manifest file (.zip file) provided by the customer support team earlier for this instance. There should be following three files once you unzip
 
    ![3 files](../../media/image%28358%29.png)
 
 1. Replace the files color.png and outline.png with your customized icon.
 
    1. Icon for color.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 192x192  
    1. Icon for  outline.png should have dimensions (in pixels): 34x32
 
 ### Step 2 – Customized the name of the icon that represents training tab in Microsoft Teams
 
 1. Open *manifest.json* in any editor (here NotePad ++) and edit the highlighted details in to represent your AzureFD (***\<name>.azurefd.net***) instance and the required name of the Tab.
 
    ![Represent your AzureFD](../../media/image%28359%29.png)
 
 2. Save your changes in the manifest.json file.
 
 ### Step 3 – Create the new Teams Manifest File and upload it
 
 1. Zip the three files (Color.png, outline.png and manifest.json) to create a new manifest zip file.
 2. Follow the instructions in the [Steps to enable learning inside Microsoft Teams document](/azure/industry/training-services/microsoft-community-training/ga-version/infrastructure-management/install-your-platform-instance/create-teams-app-for-your-training-portal), from Step 3 to upload the updated file.
 
 
 Please reach out to us [**via HelpDesk**](https://aka.ms/cthelpdesk) if you have any further queries.
